Study Title: Autologous Stem Cell Transplantation in Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
Brief Summary:
Phase III trial evaluating the role of autologous stem cell transplantation in previously untreated patients under 65 years with stage B and C B-cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia.

Endpoints of the trial :

* major : progression free survival at 3 years
* secondary : overall survival, tolerance, prognostic factors according to baseline clinical stage and biological characteristics (IgHv mutational status, expression of ZAP70 and CD38, cytogenetics).
Interventions: PROCEDURE: Autologous stem cell transplantation|PROCEDURE: DHAP rescue and Autologous stem cell transplantation|PROCEDURE: DHAP rescue and F+C
Secondary Outcome Measures: Overall survival, response after completion of scheduled treatment, tolerance and adverse events, quality of life, prognostic factors for response and survival., 36 months
Collaborators: Direction Générale de la Santé, France
Study Design: Allocation: RANDOMIZED|Intervention Model: PARALLEL|Masking: NONE|Primary Purpose: TREATMENT
Locations: DBIM Hopital Saint Louis, Paris, 75000, France
